questions.question: He has been married .................................. her for more than three decades.
questions.description: Married is followed by the preposition 'to'.

questions.question: The Irish are very proud ..................................... their sense of humor.
questions.description: The adjective proud is followed by the preposition of.

questions.question: He is interested ..................................... the supernatural.
questions.description: Interested is followed by the preposition in.

questions.question: I am pleased ............................................. your promotion.
questions.description: Pleased is followed by the preposition about.

questions.question: She was angry ........................................ me for revealing her secret.
questions.description: Angry is usually followed by the preposition. Sometimes at is also possible.

questions.question: We are all anxious ............................................. an amicable solution to this problem.
questions.description: Anxious for means eager to have.

questions.question: She is anxious ....................................... reunite with her family.
questions.description: When anxious is followed by a to-infinitive, it means eager. The above sentence means: She is eager to reunite with her family.

questions.question: You can't be independent ...................................... your parents until you find a job.
Both parents are responsible ....................................... raising a child.
I feel really sorry ........................................... his wife.
questions.description: You feel sorry for a person.
